name: ZetterbergJansen

y1.expression: Heke * (gamma_1 * (2 * e0 / (1 + np.exp(rho_1 * rho_2 - (v2 - v3)))) + gamma_1T * (U + sigm_C)) - ke_2 * y1 - keke * v1

y2.expression: Heke * (gamma_2 * (2 * e0 / (1 + np.exp(rho_1 * rho_2 - (v1)))) + gamma_2T * (P + sigm_C)) - ke_2 * y2 - keke * v2

y3.expression: Hiki * (gamma_4 * (2 * e0 / (1 + np.exp(rho_1 * rho_2 - (v4 - v5)))) - ki_2 * y3 - kiki * v3)

y4.expression: Heke * (gamma_3 * (2 * e0 / (1 + np.exp(rho_1 * rho_2 - (v2 - v3)))) + gamma_3T * (Q + sigm_C) - ke_2 * y4 - keke * v4)

y5.expression: Hiki * (gamma_5 * (2 * e0 / (1 + np.exp(rho_1 * rho_2 - (v4 - v5)))) - ki_2 * y5 - keke * v5)

docs.He: Maximum amplitude of EPSP [mV]. Also called average synaptic gain.
docs.Hi: Maximum amplitude of IPSP [mV]. Also called average synaptic gain.
docs.ke: Reciprocal of the time constant of passive membrane and all other spatially distributed delays in the dendritic network [ms^-1]. Also called average synaptic time constant.
docs.ki: Reciprocal of the time constant of passive membrane and all other spatially distributed delays in the dendritic network [ms^-1]. Also called average synaptic time constant.
docs.e0: Half of the maximum population mean firing rate [ms^-1].
docs.rho_2: Firing threshold (PSP) for which a 50% firing rate is achieved. In other words, it is the value of the average membrane potential corresponding to the inflection point of the sigmoid [mV]. Population mean firing threshold.
docs.gamma_1: Average number of synapses between populations (pyramidal to stellate).
docs.gamma_2: Average number of synapses between populations (stellate to pyramidal).
docs.gamma_1T: Coupling factor from the extrinisic input to the spiny stellate population.
docs.gamma_2T: Coupling factor from the extrinisic input to the pyramidal population.
docs.gamma_3T: Coupling factor from the extrinisic input to the inhibitory population.
docs.P: Maximum firing rate to the pyramidal population [ms^-1]. (External stimulus. Constant intensity.Entry point for coupling.)
docs.U: Maximum firing rate to the stellate population [ms^-1]. (External stimulus. Constant intensity.Entry point for coupling.)
docs.Q: Maximum firing rate to the interneurons population [ms^-1]. (External stimulus. Constant intensity.Entry point for coupling.)

references: [ZL_1978] Zetterberg LH, Kristiansson L and Mossberg K. Performance of a Model for a Local Neuron Population. Biological Cybernetics 31, 15-26, 1978.
[JB_1995]  Jansen, B., H. and Rit V., G., *Electroencephalogram and visual evoked potential generation in a mathematical model of coupled cortical columns*, Biological Cybernetics (73) 357:366, 1995.
[JB_1993] Jansen, B., Zouridakis, G. and Brandt, M., *A neurophysiologically-based mathematical model of flash visual evoked potentials*
